items.label: Deploy your resources to a control plane

builders-workshop/deployment.title: Deploy your resources to a control plane
builders-workshop/deployment.description: Create a dev control plane and deploy to your cloud

builders-workshop/project-foundations.title: Project Foundations
builders-workshop/project-foundations.description: Create a new project from scratch

consumer-portal-get-started.title: Learn
consumer-portal-get-started.description: Learn how Upbound works and how it can work for you.

core-concepts/claims.title: Claims
core-concepts/claims.description: Sets of managed resources as a single control plane object.

core-concepts/compositions.title: Compositions
core-concepts/compositions.description: Compositions are declarative templates that enable the creation of multiple managed resources

core-concepts/control-planes.title: Control Planes
core-concepts/control-planes.description: A centralized management layer that enables the orchestration of cloud resources and services across multiple providers.

core-concepts/functions.title: Functions
core-concepts/functions.description: Custom programs that dynamically template resources.

core-concepts/managed-control-planes.title: Managed Control Planes
core-concepts/managed-control-planes.description: Fully isolated Crossplane control plane instances that Upbound manages for you

core-concepts/projects.title: Control Plane Projects
core-concepts/projects.description: The source of your control plane configurations. A control plane project contains the `upbound.yaml` file and any dependencies for your project.

core-concepts/providers.title: Providers
core-concepts/providers.description: Providers allow Upbound to provision infrastructure on an external service. They handle communication between the control plane and your external resources

core-concepts/xrds.title: Composite Resource Definitions (XRDs)
core-concepts/xrds.description: Composite resource definitions (XRDs) define the schema for a custom API.

get-started.title: Get Started
get-started.description: Use the Upbound CLI to create infrastructure and have more control of your configurations
